notes:
1. Definition

Sustainable development is development that meets the needs of the present without compromising the ability of future generations to meet their own needs. It is about finding a balance between environmental protection, social equity, and economic viability.

2. The Three Pillars of Sustainability

Sustainability is often represented as having three interconnected dimensions or pillars:

  • Environmental Sustainability: The ability to maintain rates of renewable resource harvest, pollution creation, and non-renewable resource depletion that can be continued indefinitely. It involves protecting ecosystems and biodiversity.
  • Social Sustainability: The ability of a social system, such as a community, to function at a defined level of social well-being indefinitely. It includes issues of equity, public health, community development, and human rights.
  • Economic Sustainability: The ability to support a defined level of economic production indefinitely. A sustainable economy must be able to produce goods and services on a continuing basis, to maintain manageable levels of government and external debt, and to avoid extreme sectoral imbalances which damage agricultural or industrial production.

True sustainability is achieved when all three pillars are in balance.

solvedExamples.question: Which of the following best describes the concept of sustainable engineering design?

options.text: Designing a product that has the lowest possible manufacturing cost.
Designing a product that uses only recycled materials.
Designing a product that balances environmental, social, and economic impacts throughout its life cycle.
Designing a product that meets all current government environmental regulations.

solvedExamples.explanation: Sustainability is a holistic concept. While cost, recycled materials, and regulations are all part of it, the core idea is the integration and balancing of the three pillars: environmental (planet), social (people), and economic (profit).

solvedExamples.question: The 'Three Pillars' of sustainability are commonly referred to as:
solvedExamples.explanation: The globally recognized model for sustainability is based on balancing three interconnected dimensions: environmental stewardship, social responsibility, and economic viability.
